Description: Long bone drill or peg. Carved from mammal bone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Redpath Museum, Montreal. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to accompanying label: 'Bone pegs Sa-el-hagar Naukratis (late work)'. A number of bone piercers, stiles, and inlay points were found in the Archaic Artemisia at Ephesus (Hogarth 1908, 193-5, pl. xxxvii-xl).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (WB.22) (Phase 3)
